Package org.moera.lib.node.types.validate

Class ValidationUtil

java.lang.Object
org.moera.lib.node.types.validate.ValidationUtil
public class ValidationUtil extends Object
Utility class for common validation checks.

  • Constructor Details

    • ValidationUtil

      public ValidationUtil()

  • Method Details

    • assertion

      public static void assertion(boolean condition, String errorCode)
      Asserts that the given condition is true. If the condition is false, a ValidationFailure is thrown with the specified error code.
      Parameters:
      condition - the boolean condition to be validated
      errorCode - the error code to be used in the exception if the condition is false
      Throws:
      ValidationFailure - if the condition is false

    • notNull

      public static void notNull(Object value, String errorCode)
      Ensures that the provided value is not null. If the value is null, a ValidationFailure is thrown with the specified error code.
      Parameters:
      value - the object to be validated for nullity
      errorCode - the error code to be used in the exception if the value is null
      Throws:
      ValidationFailure - if the value is null

    • notBlank

      public static void notBlank(String value, String errorCode)
      Validates that the provided string is neither null nor empty. If the string is null or empty, a ValidationFailure is thrown with the specified error code.
      Parameters:
      value - the string to validate for non-blank content
      errorCode - the error code to be used in the exception if the string is null or empty
      Throws:
      ValidationFailure - if the string is null or empty

    • maxSize

      public static void maxSize(String value, int maxSize, String errorCode)
      Validates that the provided string does not exceed the specified maximum size. If the string is not null and its length exceeds the maximum size, a ValidationFailure is thrown with the specified error code.
      Parameters:
      value - the string to validate
      maxSize - the maximum allowed size for the string
      errorCode - the error code to be used in the exception if the validation fails
      Throws:
      ValidationFailure - if the string length exceeds the specified maximum size

    • maxSize

      public static void maxSize(Body value, int maxSize, String errorCode)
      Validates that the encoded representation of the provided Body object does not exceed the specified maximum size. If the Body object is not null, its encoded string representation is validated. If the length of the encoded string exceeds the maximum allowed size, a ValidationFailure is thrown with the specified error code.
      Parameters:
      value - the Body object whose encoded representation is to be validated
      maxSize - the maximum allowed size for the encoded string representation
      errorCode - the error code to be used in the exception if the validation fails
      Throws:
      ValidationFailure - if the encoded string representation of value exceeds the specified maximum size

    • minValue

      public static void minValue(Integer value, int min, String errorCode)
      Validates that the provided integer value is either null or greater than or equal to the specified minimum value. If the validation fails, a ValidationFailure is thrown with the specified error code.
      Parameters:
      value - the integer value to validate
      min - the minimum allowed value for the integer
      errorCode - the error code to be used in the exception if the validation fails
      Throws:
      ValidationFailure - if the integer value is not null and less than the specified minimum

    • minValue

      public static void minValue(Long value, long min, String errorCode)
      Validates that the provided long value is either null or greater than or equal to the specified minimum value. If the validation fails, a ValidationFailure is thrown with the specified error code.
      Parameters:
      value - the long value to validate
      min - the minimum allowed value for the long
      errorCode - the error code to be used in the exception if the validation fails
      Throws:
      ValidationFailure - if the long value is not null and less than the specified minimum

    • minValue

      public static void minValue(Float value, float min, String errorCode)
      Validates that the provided float value is either null or greater than or equal to the specified minimum value. If the validation fails, a ValidationFailure is thrown with the specified error code.
      Parameters:
      value - the float value to validate
      min - the minimum allowed value for the float
      errorCode - the error code to be used in the exception if the validation fails
      Throws:
      ValidationFailure - if the float value is not null and less than the specified minimum

    • maxValue

      public static void maxValue(Integer value, int max, String errorCode)
      Validates that the provided integer value is either null or less than or equal to the specified maximum value. If the validation fails, a ValidationFailure is thrown with the specified error code.
      Parameters:
      value - the integer value to validate
      max - the maximum allowed value for the integer
      errorCode - the error code to be used in the exception if the validation fails
      Throws:
      ValidationFailure - if the integer value is not null and exceeds the specified maximum

    • maxValue

      public static void maxValue(Long value, long max, String errorCode)
      Validates that the provided long value is either null or less than or equal to the specified maximum value. If the validation fails, a ValidationFailure is thrown with the specified error code.
      Parameters:
      value - the long value to validate
      max - the maximum allowed value for the long
      errorCode - the error code to be used in the exception if the validation fails
      Throws:
      ValidationFailure - if the long value is not null and exceeds the specified maximum

    • maxValue

      public static void maxValue(Float value, float max, String errorCode)
      Validates that the provided float value is either null or less than or equal to the specified maximum value. If the validation fails, a ValidationFailure is thrown with the specified error code.
      Parameters:
      value - the float value to validate
      max - the maximum allowed value for the float
      errorCode - the error code to be used in the exception if the validation fails
      Throws:
      ValidationFailure - if the float value is not null and exceeds the specified maximum

    • minItems

      public static void minItems(Object[] array, int minItems, String errorCode)
      Validates that the given array is either null or contains at least the specified minimum number of items. If the validation fails, a ValidationFailure is thrown with the specified error code.
      Parameters:
      array - the array to validate
      minItems - the minimum number of items required in the array
      errorCode - the error code to be used in the exception if the validation fails
      Throws:
      ValidationFailure - if the array is not null and contains fewer than the specified minimum number of items

    • minItems

      public static void minItems(Collection<?> collection, int minItems, String errorCode)
      Validates that a given collection has at least a specified minimum number of items.
      Parameters:
      collection - the collection to be checked; can be null
      minItems - the minimum number of items the collection should contain
      errorCode - the error code to be used if the collection does not meet the minimum size requirement

    • maxItems

      public static void maxItems(Object[] array, int maxItems, String errorCode)
      Validates that the given array is either null or contains at most the specified maximum number of items. If the validation fails, a ValidationFailure is thrown with the specified error code.
      Parameters:
      array - the array to validate
      maxItems - the maximum number of items allowed in the array
      errorCode - the error code to be used in the exception if the validation fails
      Throws:
      ValidationFailure - if the array is not null and contains more than the specified maximum number of items

    • maxItems

      public static void maxItems(Collection<?> collection, int maxItems, String errorCode)
      Validates that a given collection has at most a specified minimum number of items.
      Parameters:
      collection - the collection to be checked; can be null
      maxItems - the maximum number of items the collection should contain
      errorCode - the error code to be used if the collection does not meet the maximum size requirement

    • domainName

      public static void domainName(String value, String errorCode)
      Validates that the given string follows the domain name format. If the string is neither null nor empty, it is checked against the defined domain name pattern. If validation fails, a ValidationFailure is thrown with the specified error code.
      Parameters:
      value - the string to validate as a domain name
      errorCode - the error code to be used in the exception if the validation fails
      Throws:
      ValidationFailure - if the string is not null, not empty, and does not match the domain name pattern

    • email

      public static void email(String value, String errorCode)
      Validates that the provided string is either null, empty, or matches the email pattern. If the string does not meet these criteria, a ValidationFailure is thrown with the specified error code.
      Parameters:
      value - the string to validate as an email address
      errorCode - the error code to be used in the exception if the validation fails
      Throws:
      ValidationFailure - if the string is not null, not empty, and does not match the email pattern

    • emojiList

      public static void emojiList(String value, String errorCode)
      Validates that the provided string is either null, empty, or is a valid emoji list. If the string does not meet these criteria, a ValidationFailure is thrown with the specified error code.
      Parameters:
      value - the string to validate as a list of emojis
      errorCode - the error code to be used in the exception if the validation fails
      Throws:
      ValidationFailure - if the string is not null, not empty, and not a valid emoji list.
